precontext: John was sitting in his favorite chair, sipping his morning coffee. He loved the quiet moments before his busy day started. Every morning, he liked to glance out of his window to see what was happening outside.
sentence: He could see a plant from his window.
meanings_considered: an actor situated in the audience whose acting is rehearsed but seems spontaneous to the audience
(botany) a living organism lacking the power of locomotion
explanation:
• The precontext describes John looking out his window at the garden, which strongly suggests a botanical entity.  
• "Plant" as an actor in the audience would be highly unusual in this setting and lacks contextual support.  
• The phrase "a plant from his window" naturally refers to a visible object outside, consistent with a living plant in a garden.
clear_meaning_text: (botany) a living organism lacking the power of locomotion
